Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and black in section, both interior and exterior are covered with a light-brown slip, four lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.189)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36448) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36448)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 307 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13494 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
